bodydiv.p: For each technical project, the Board assesses whether it has complied with its due process requirements, on the basis of a technical staff report that:

li.p: includes a summary of any matters raised about due process, the extent of stakeholder engagement and the areas in a proposed IFRS Standard or IFRIC Interpretation that are likely to be controversial;
provides evidence and evaluation of the process that was undertaken;
outlines the reasons why the Board decided not to undertake a non-mandatory ‘comply or explain’ step for a given project (see paragraphs 3.45–3.46); and
concludes whether, in the technical staff’s opinion, applicable due process steps have been complied with.

bodydiv.p: Any such reports are communicated to the DPOC, giving it sufficient time to review them and to react in a timely manner.
